channel.title: Life Misc on ☴ so it flows ☵
channel.description: Recent content in Life Misc on ☴ so it flows ☵

item.title: My Doom Emacs Configuration
item.description: Intro Forewords A few words about my background. I’m a researcher in the field of social science. I don’t program much, but Emacs is essential for both my work and leisure projects. I’m using Emacs for interacting with R environment, composing long format texts, and managing my schedule as well as logging everyday life. I’m using GNU Emacs under the Doom Emacs configuration framework. I’m running my Emacs in iTerm2–a terminal emulator for macOS.

item.title: Hugo Org Sandbox
item.description: Basic formatting list item checkbox item numbered item regular main text, bold, italic, underlined, verbatim, code, strike-through Paragraphs Great clouds overhead Tiny black birds rise and fail Snow covers Emacs        --- AlexSchroeder Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not any simpler —ALbert Einstein .org-center { margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center; } A fog sinks in, and it overlays the death. Math symbols X2, X2

item.title: Planning 2020: Beyond Work-Life Balance
item.description: A Broken Self and a New Decade With the tingly smell of mulled wine, the dazzling Christmas lights in Berlin streets, I found myself in a very dark place at the end of 2019: it’s the end of a decade yet my life is full of loose ends. Trying so hard to be the best version of myself as an instructor, a scholar, and a creator, I had, not literally, untied shoe laces that will trip myself over nothing every single day.

item.title: R Sandbox
item.description: Testing org-babel R block automatic graphic output persistent R session present both codes and outputs setwd('~/itflows/content-org/') library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Width, y = Sepal.Length)) + geom_point() square <- function(x) { x * x } square(1:10) [1] 1 4 9 16 25 36 49 64 81 100
